- "nikan i" refers to "Chinese" or "of the Chinese."

- "emgi" means "one" or "a."

- "tefi" means "to arrive" or "having arrived."
- "bithe" means "letter" or "document."
- "taqiha" means "to write" or "written."
- "turgunde" means "at that time" or "then."
- "majige" means "a little" or "slightly."
- "bahanambi" means "to be surprised" or "to be amazed."

### The next day, having arrived at one place, a Chinese letter was written, and then they were slightly surprised. ###
